hedline.hl1: A Juice Bar For That Natural High

abstract.p: Elixer, popular juice bar in West Village, opens new outlet in TriBeCa; drawing (New Yorkers & Co column) (S)

block.p: With herbal remedies growing in popularity, Elixir, a West Village juice bar, opened a new store in TriBeCa last month. The ultramodern store at 95 West Broadway near Chambers Street serves smoothies and juices made from basic fruits to complex herbal combinations.

Hanging on the walls are large glass tubes containing ingredients of many of the drinks, like gingko and cinnamon root. A Remedy Board suggests various juices and herbs you might consume to bolster health or cure ailments like colds, flu or high blood pressure.

With herbal remedies growing in popularity, Elixir, a West Village juice bar, opened a new store in TriBeCa last month. The ultramodern store at 95 West Broadway near Chambers Street serves smoothies and juices made from basic fruits to complex herbal combinations.

Hanging on the walls are large glass tubes containing ingredients of many of the drinks, like gingko and cinnamon root. A Remedy Board suggests various juices and herbs you might consume to bolster health or cure ailments like colds, flu or high blood pressure.
''We're like a modern apothecary,'' says the owner, Liz Ilgenfritz, whose store also offers one-ounce shots of wheat-grass extract to cleanse the body.
